content: Hey @Jasun Carr -- is there an easy source that is accessible to me where I can just read over the free form responses, in particular to questions like "If you find it difficult to participate in the Rust community, and feel comfortable giving more details, please tell us what makes it difficult"
(or to anyone else, if others know)
I guess I can open each of the various google survey docs etc

I'll get the full compiled spreadsheet into the Drive folder today so that
everyone has access to it.

D. Jasun Carr, Ph.D.

Associate Professor - Digital Media | Department of Communication, Media, &
Persuasion

Vice-Chair | ISU Faculty Senate

Faculty Senator | College of Arts & Letters

Video Production & Minor Advisor

Liberal Arts Building | Room 128A

921 South 8th Ave., Stop 8265 | Pocatello, ID 83209

carrdavi@isu.edul

The full sheet is in drive: RUST2020_COMBINED.xlsx Excel keeps doing the annoying thing of changing some of the ranges (eg. 10-25) to dates (eg. Oct. 25) or even that odd numerical date format (eg. 44160). But the vast majority is easy to deal with.

re: Excel worksheets, you can set the format of the cells to "Text" (right-click, set cell properties or something, and there's a listbox) then excel will stop trying to auto recognize numbers and dates.
